full_text:
LATE FILING PENALTIES.
	(Amended by Ord. No. 170,538, Eff. 7/13/95.)

	If any person files an original statement or report after any deadline imposed by this article, he or she shall, in addition to any other penalties or remedies established by the article, be liable to the City in the amount of twenty five dollars ($25) per day after the deadline until the statement or report is filed. Liability need not be enforced by the City if the Commission on an impartial basis determines that the late filing was not willful and that enforcement of the liability will not further the purposes of the article, except that no liability shall be waived if a statement or report is not filed within 30 days.

1.name: Municipal Ethics And Conflicts Of Interest
1.label: article

1.catch_line: Restrictions On Gifts And Travel Expenses.

2.catch_line: Lobbying Activities Of Current And Former City Officials.

4.catch_line: Participation Of Elective City Officers And Employees In Governmental Decisions.

6.catch_line: Contract Bidder And Proposer Disclosure – Political Contributions And Fundraising Activity.

7.catch_line: Disclosure By Elective Officers In Connection With Lobbying Interests And City Contractors.

13.catch_line: Effect Of Campaign Money Laundering Violation On Contracts And Fee Waivers.

18.catch_line: Protection Of Employees Against Retaliation For Reporting Fraud, Waste Or Misuse Of Office.

19.catch_line: Misuse Of City Position Or Resource.

20.catch_line: Disclosure Regarding Economic Interests And Other Outside Interests.

23.catch_line: Restrictions On Honoraria And Outside Earned Income.

next_section.catch_line: Effect Of Campaign Money Laundering Violation On Contracts And Fee Waivers.

plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE

LATE FILING PENALTIES. (§ 49.5.20)

  LATE FILING PENALTIES.
	(Amended by Ord. No. 170,538, Eff. 7/13/95.)	If any person files an original
statement or report after any deadline imposed by this article, he or she shall,
in addition to any other penalties or remedies established by the article, be
liable to the City in the amount of twenty five dollars ($25) per day after the
deadline until the statement or report is filed. Liability need not be enforced
by the City if the Commission on an impartial basis determines that the late
filing was not willful and that enforcement of the liability will not further
the purposes of the article, except that no liability shall be waived if a
statement or report is not filed within 30 days.

Liability need not be enforced by the City if the Commission on an impartial basis determines that the late filing was not willful and that enforcement of the liability will not further the purposes of the article, except that no liability shall be waived if a statement or report is not filed within 30 days.
